statement: Moving sample_count/evidence_cap to run-level configuration can reduce template/version churn while preserving reproducibility if run records snapshot those values.
rationale: Runs already snapshot policy and have a run_config link; counts can be added there without changing experiment identity.
keyAssumptions: Spec signatures can exclude counts without breaking uniqueness semantics.
validationCriteria: Spec signature consumers tolerate removal of count fields; run summaries expose run-level counts.
critiquePoints: Dropping counts from spec signatures may reduce drift detection.
questions: Do any consumers depend on counts being in experiment config for filtering/analytics?
